review_content:
I was looking for a warm deep red blush and came across Clinique "Black Honey." It appeared to be perfect, the exact color I was looking for, and the name had me completely sold. After receiving the blush, a more fitting name would be 'pink honey'. The blush is rosey pink, definitely not the darker deep color in the pictures. Even the swatch on the model doesnt represent to how this really looks in person. Instead of altering the pictures, just make a darker blush! I gave it 2 stars because even though it was too light, it did apply and sit well on my skin. It's sad because during these months, all we can rely on are the pictures and they're unreliable and untrustworthy.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Pink Pop/Heather Pop: not suitable for darker skin
review_content:
It's lovely, I love how you can build up pigment, I love how it doesn't emphasize texture. However, well.... for years I've always had the experience that Clinique products just aren't suited to darker skin colours and tones, for me it's just never ever worked.. there's always something off. Same with this lovely little blush. There's a sort of white undertone that shows up on my skin, not exactly chalky, more like if you smeared a thin film of zinc oxide on your skin. I don't like it. Alas as a result I had to return this beauty. If I were lighter skinned this would work better for me. For reference I'm a CoverFX N70, or generally the colour of Caramel.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
First let me say that this is a nice blush if you have fair/light/pale skin. It is very subtle and almost impossible to overdo. I also really like the formula. It does not look powdery on the skin, and it applies evenly and blends beautifully. That being said, I was sadly very disappointed with the color. This should be named "Honey", not "Pink Honey", as there is little to no pink in this color at all, and it does not look pink on my skin by any stretch of the imagination. Unfortunately, there are no nice light pinks or mauves at all in this collection. The pinks are all either neon bright, or very peachy/brown. I was really hoping this would be a nice, natural light pink, but I was wrong. I wish Clinique would consider coming out with some light pinkish colors for the fair and light skinned girls. I will use this and try layering a light pink over it, but I will not purchase again.

I ended up trying a MAC blush in color "Sweet Enough," and that is now my holy grail! Pale girls need to try it out!

review_title: Nude Pop is the best everyday shade
review_content:
I bought the shade Nude Pop and it's a perfect everyday blush. I have a yellow undertone so a lot of the typical nude pink shades just don't work for me as an everyday shade. user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Such a great underrated blush! Money well spent.
review_content:
In general I don’t tend to seek out Clinique products—I guess I unfairly characterize them as “old fashioned”... but these are just the nicest little blushes! I picked up Pansy Pop when I decided I wanted a lavender toned blush and couldn’t find any other line with one that was just the right colour, and this has turned out to be one of my favourite all time blushes— and that’s saying a lot, as my drawer is full of several Nars, Hourglass, Chanel and Buxom otherwise. I have almost used it up and will definitely buy again. It goes on sheer at first but easily layers without caking on and looking powdery so is flexible to whatever look you’re going for. This Pansy Pop shade is beautiful and fresh looking on my fair olive skin and looks awesome with a similar colour lip. It actually can look really natural with a light hint of bronzer or contour if you are a very fair skinned girl and I don’t know why it’s such a hard shade to find.

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Pansy Pop- Most wearable Lavender Blush!
review_content:
Picked this blush up yesterday because I was looking for a spring blush that was different than the typical rosy pink and Pansy Pop was perfect! Lavender is my favorite color and I wasn't sure I could pull off a purple blush but it gives the most beautiful fresh, yet just came in from the cold, flush. It has just enough warmth in it to keep from veering into the unnatural appearance some cool-toned purples can give. For reference, I have strawberry blonde hair, blue-green eyes, and fair skin with a neutral undertone (I'm a perfect match for shade 1N2 Vanilla in Laura Mercier's Flawless Lumiere Radiance foundation). Would look beautiful on warm undertones, as well as slightly cool undertones as it does impart a hint of warmth when applied to the skin. Looks beautiful paired with white gold and peachy/pink highlighters. Applies sheer with one coat but can be easily built up for a much bolder look. Also lasted through a two hour powerlifting training session so I'd say it has some pretty heavy duty lasting power. (;

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I own four of these (Pansy, Peach, Ginger, and Berry) and they are my favorite blushes in my collection. The formula is buildable which is great since you can control how saturated your cheeks will be. It also looks very natural, in my opinion. For reference, I'm light-medium with cool olive undertones (Asian). Out of all the shades I own, Peach is my favorite. It's brightening on me and has just the right balance of warmth and cool pink. I've always wanted Cola but I don't think it would suit me since it's darker and more pigmented than the ones I own. l noticed that the more saturated blushes with colors more suited for medium to deep skintones are a lot more pigmented than the softer/lighter shades. Even Berry is a little harder for me to control since it can really pack a punch that can clash with my lighter complexion. All in all, I love this blush collection and I like that pigmentation changes depending on the shade. While I am a little bummed out that Cola is too pigmented for me, I can see how someone who's darker than me would like its stronger and more saturated color and pigment.

review_content: Starting with the presentation, the packaging is sturdy and secure enough to toss in a purse or makeup bag, and trust it won't come apart. The flower shape is ADORABLE! user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I love this blush - the colour, the consistency and the staying power but can only give it 2 stars because I hate the container. It’s so hard to open! Today was the day I tossed my half used Clinique Cheek POP blush in the trash because I’m tired of breaking my gel nails to open the flip top - it’s just not worth the time and cost to keep getting nail repairs. :(

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This is hands down one of my most favorite blushes! Pigmented and vibrant, always makes me look more fresh and awake. I have worn this consistently 2/3 times a week since the summer and still have not even used up 90% of the product. It is a bit pricey but will definitely last you a long time.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Cute packaging, smooth texture (that imparts a subtle, glowy sheen without being sparkly) and buildable pigmentation... whats not to love? I have a couple of these blushes, my favorite is ginger pop, as fig pop doesnt really suit my complexion. All in all, highly recommend. Love clinique!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Ebony']
review_content: The color on screen is deceptive. In person it is several shades lighter.

review_content: Bought this to test out how the pink colour looks on my cheeks. Initially I had the trouble with it’s really light coloured appearance, with my skin tone I need to apply it maybe 3-4 times to make it a bit visible.

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Love these blushes. I own 2 and am now getting a third shade. I always reach for these over any other blushes! They look very natural and can really be customized since they are not intensely pigmented on first swipe- they can be built up easily as well! This makes them very easy to apply you won’t have to worry about over doing the blush which I find is easy to do with many other blushes. A few people have told me the shade I use heather pop looks very natural- it’s close to my natural flush which could also be why! Recommend these to everyone

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: FINALLY! A blush that is pigmented enough to compete with colored lips! I’ve had a heck of a time finding a blush in my color palette that was pigmented enough to actually show up when I put any kind of color on my lips. But this blush is fantastic! A little goes a long way which makes it worth the price!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I love this product and it gives best results when used with a puff than a brush. You have to be careful because it is easy to apply too much but I love the color!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
This shade is so beautiful! It leaves a glowy pink look on your cheeks even though the blush is matte! it's hard to explain how a matte blush can make your cheeks look "glowy" but this is that blush! My only gripe with this product & the reason I am not giving 4 out of 5 stars is because I have the HARDEST time picking this up on a brush! I have not tried any of the other Clinique blushes so I'm not sure if this is the norm or if mine was sitting on the shelf before I bought it but I have to apply this with my fingers first and then blend it out with a brush. Does anyone else have this issue with Pansy Pop?

review_content: Love this blush! The plum color was kind of intimidating but on the cheeks it shows up as a really pretty blush. This is my go-to blush for the winter because it gives you a really pretty natural “my cheeks are naturally this color from the cold” vibe.

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Great lasting power and natural finish. I find that this color works well with the pinker undertones of my skin.

This is hands down my favorite blush formula. It’s unbelievable but I have 8 of the shades! My favorites have to be Melon, Fig, Nude, and Peach pop. The formula is non-powdery and blends into the skin so effortlessly. Leaves a healthy sheen without all the sparkles. It naturally brightens up my complexion. It’s sheer, but easily buildable so you don’t have to worry about looking like a clown. The price point and color selection is just great, these are unbeatable!

review_title: Beautiful, Easy to Apply, and Long Lasting
review_content: It is long lasting with beautiful color. It is not too pigmented so it is very easy to control the amount even for beginners. I think I'll gradually collect all the cheek pop shades <3 Also Korea has two new shades called 'Poppy Pop' and 'Sorbet Pop' that are also very beautiful. So if you have friends in Korea or are visiting there for some reason, I recommend you to grab those two new shades as well.
